turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Simple eye in invertebrates.
turn.1: What are the differences between compound eyes and simple eyes?
turn.2: Spiders do not have compound eyes, but instead have several pairs of simple eyes with each pair adapted for a specific task or tasks.
turn.3: Are the eyes located near the front of the head?
turn.4: The principal and secondary eyes in spiders are arranged in four or more pairs.
turn.5: Are the eyes covered by scales?
turn.6: Only the principal eyes have moveable retinas.
turn.7: What is another name for the reflector?
turn.8: The secondary eyes have a reflector at the back of the eyes.
turn.9: What is the purpose of the reflector?
turn.10: The light-sensitive part of the receptor cells is next to this, so they get direct and reflected light.
turn.11: Are the eyes used for vision?
turn.12: In hunting or jumping spiders, for example, a forward-facing pair possesses the best resolution (and even telescopic components) to see the (often small) prey at a large distance.
